rationale: English language has a special place in every sphere of life. In today's world, it acts as a 'lingua franca'. Therefore, the need of learning English has become more important for an engineering student. The course curriculum aims at LSRW (Listening, Speaking, Reading and Writing) skills, which will help students to be competent in communication at the workplace. The course has been designed to actively engage students in the learning process through Task Based Language Learning (TBLL) approach.
competency: Use reading, writing, speaking, listening skills to communicate effectively in English

courseOutcomes.description: Use strategies to minimise barriers of effective communication
Develop reading and listening skills in terms of fluency and comprehensibility
Compose different types of written communication
Communicate orally in a given situation with a purpose

practicalExercises.description: Listening Practice: Listening to conversations and making notes about the gist of conversations, listening to lectures and note making, listen to instructions and follow them, listen to description and paraphrase it

Reading Practice: Reading practice of different types of text, dictionary use for finding meaning and pronunciation, reading unseen passages, reading with correct pronunciation and deriving meaning, reading skills development
Speaking Practice: Conversation practice, asking and answering questions, giving instructions, role plays, formal and informal situations practice, pronunciation and intonation practice
Writing Practice: Writing practice on different topics, email writing, letter writing, paragraph writing, grammar exercises, sentence construction practice
